videos.overview: Sammi Kinghorn returns to Cumbria to find out how young shepherdess Katie is doing now that she's finished school for the year.

videos.title: One Man and His Dog
videos.overview: From the Goodwood Estate in West Sussex, four of the UK's top sheepdog handlers go head-to-head, aiming to claim 2023's One Man and His Dog trophy.

videos.title: Harvest 1
videos.overview: Adam Henson and Sean Fletcher join the Martin family on their Cambridgeshire arable farm at harvest, a time that can be financial 'make or break' for many UK farmers.

videos.title: Harvest 2
videos.overview: Adam Henson and Sean Fletcher are back in the breadbasket' of East Anglia as farmer Tom Martin learns if this year's harvest has been a success.

videos.title: Highland Games Compilation
videos.overview: Hamza Yassin fulfils a long-standing ambition by taking a trip to Royal Deeside to attend the Braemar Highland Gathering.

videos.title: Autumn Spectacle
videos.overview: Joe Crowley and Charlotte Smith head to the Wash in Norfolk to see one of the greatest wildlife events in the UK, the Snettisham Spectacular.

videos.title: Agmash Auction Hub
videos.overview: Adam Henson and Charlotte Smith are in Cambridgeshire at Cheffins' famous agricultural machinery auction, the ultimate trading floor for farm equipment.

videos.title: Ramble for Children in Need 2023
videos.overview: It's time for presenters Matt Baker, Charlotte Smith, Margherita Taylor, Joe Crowley and John Craven to pull on their bobble hats and get rambling in aid of Children in Need 2023.

videos.title: Wild Britain
videos.overview: As part of Countryfile's Wild Britain initiative, Ellie Harrison and Hamza Yassin visit Wytham Woods in Oxfordshire.

videos.title: South Downs
videos.overview: John Craven and Sammi Kinghorn visit the South Downs to see how the past is inspiring residents to preserve the future of this diverse landscape.

videos.title: Dumfries House
videos.overview: Countryfile returns to Dumfries House as autumn is in full swing and the first year of teaching gets underway at the new rural skills centre recently opened by the King.

videos.title: Poole Harbour
videos.overview: Ellie Harrison and Anita Rani are at Poole Harbour for the conclusion of a three-year environmental study, and thety celebrate Ellie's last Countryfile episode with a trip down memory lane.

videos.title: Elan Valley
videos.overview: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker head to Elan Valley, nestled in the heart of the Cambrian Mountains, where the Welsh natural world is getting ready for the onset of winter.

videos.title: Country Lore
videos.overview: The team meet with experts to learn about nature and the behaviour of wildlife in the winter, and what folk wisdom across the centuries can teach us about the season.

videos.title: A Cumbrian Christmas
videos.overview: The team return to the Cumbrian fells to learn of 16-year-old shepherdess Katie and her family's Christmas traditions on their upland farm.

videos.title: River Lea
videos.overview: Margherita Taylor goes for a wintry walk alongside the River Lea, meeting historian Dr Jim Lewis, who describes its history from the ice ages to the present day.

videos.title: Norfolk North Sea
videos.overview: Anita Rani and Matt Baker head to Blakeney National Nature Reserve, a four-mile-long shingle spit that offers protection and provides a perfect habitat for grey seals to come ashore and breed.

videos.title: Tamara Way
videos.overview: Charlotte Smith and Sammi Kinghorn visit the Tamara Coast-to-Coast Way, connecting the north and south of Cornwall's coastal paths for the very first time.

videos.title: Newport
videos.overview: Sammi Kinghorn and Matt Baker witness one of nature's greatest displays  a starling murmuration  at the Newport Wetlands National Nature Reserve in south Wales.

videos.title: Somerset Willow Harvest
videos.overview: Joe Crowley is in the Somerset Levels to experience the history, heritage and farming of this unique wetland environment. Up in the Cotswolds, Adam Henson is busy restoring his ancient orchard.

videos.title: Bodmin Moor
videos.overview: Matt Baker and Charlotte Smith learn how Bodmin Moor, a windswept terrain scarred by its industrial past, is gearing up to welcome back wildlife.

videos.title: Ashdown Forest
videos.overview: Matt Baker and Charlotte Smith visit Ashdown Forest in East Sussex, the inspiration for Winnie-the-Pooh's magical home, 100 Aker Wood, to learn more about this ancient woodland.

videos.title: Snowdrops
videos.overview: Joe Crowley and Anita Rani are at the Colesbourne estate in the Cotswolds, where its gardens at this time of year are home to millions of one hardy flower  the snowdrop.

videos.title: Powis Castle Compilation
videos.overview: Britain is home to over 4,000 castles. Charlotte Smith visits one of Wales's finest, Powis Castle, to explore the impressive grounds and grand rooms of this former medieval fortress.

videos.title: Pontcysyllte Canal
videos.overview: Matt Baker and Charlotte Smith head to the UK's longest and highest aqueduct, the Pontcysyllte Aqueduct in north Wales, and Joe Crowley investigates claims of threats to Britain's historic waterways.

videos.title: RNLI 200 Years
videos.overview: As the RNLI celebrates its 200th anniversary, Matt Baker and Sammi Kinghorn meet some of its volunteers at the charity's station in Minehead, Somerset.

videos.title: Wessex Downs
videos.overview: Charlotte Smith and Sean Fletcher explore Marlborough Downs, which is home to one of the UK's newest nature reserves  Bay Meadows.

videos.title: Archaeology at Hinton Ampner
videos.overview: Anita Rani visits Hinton Ampner in Winchester, a medieval village and Georgian country estate that is also the site of both Neolithic and Bronze Age settlements and barrows.

videos.title: Trent Valley
videos.overview: Margherita Taylor and Matt Baker head to the Trent Valley, where over the past two centuries, industrialisation along the river Trent has taken its toll on the landscape.

videos.title: Westonbirt Arboretum
videos.overview: Hamza Yassin and Charlotte Smith celebrate the arrival of spring at the majestic 600-acre National Arboretum at Westonbirt in Gloucestershire, home to a collection of 2,500 different tree species.

videos.title: Wrynose and Hardknott Passes
videos.overview: Buckle up as Anita Rani and Matt Baker are on a road trip along the Hardknott and Wrynose Passes in the heart of the Lake District.

videos.title: Wisley Bees
videos.overview: From the blooming gardens of RHS Wisley in Surrey, Hamza Yassin and Sammi Kinghorn celebrate one of nature's heroes  the not-so-humble bee!

videos.title: Rutland
videos.overview: Sean Fletcher and Margherita Taylor travel to Rutland, historically the smallest county in England. Despite its size, it is home to the largest man-made body of water in the country  Rutland Water.

videos.title: Lambing
videos.overview: To wrap up this year's lambing season, Countryfile is at Adam Henson's farm in the Cotswolds to see what's next for his new spring additions.

videos.title: Rural Mental Health
videos.overview: Ahead of Mental Health Awareness Week, Sean Fletcher and Margherita Taylor travel to the Sharpham Trust, located in the beautiful wilds of south Devon.

videos.title: Northumberland Coast
videos.overview: Joe Crowley celebrates the 60th anniversary of the National Nature Reserve at Lindisfarne and joins the ranger team protecting nesting ringed plover on the shore.

videos.title: Camel Trail
videos.overview: Adam Henson and Charlotte Smith travel to north Cornwall to explore the history of the Camel Trail, encounter local wildlife and meet the people that live and work along its route.

videos.title: D-Day: 80th Anniversary
videos.overview: Anita Rani and Charlotte Smith travel to Dorset, where 80 years ago, tens of thousands of troops amassed as the Allies' combined forces prepared for D-Day.

videos.title: South Wales Farming
videos.overview: Charlotte Smith and Joe Crowley head to southwest Wales, where they help with a kelp harvest at Cr-y-Mr, Wales' first regenerative ocean farm.

videos.title: Hidden Treasures of Wanlockhead
videos.overview: Sammi Kinghorn and Sean Fletcher explore the natural riches and hidden treasures of Wanlockhead  the highest village in Scotland.

videos.title: Three Rivers Race
videos.overview: Joe Crowley joins the teams at the Horning Sailing Club as they get ready for the Three Rivers Race.

videos.title: The East Riding of Yorkshire
videos.overview: From the towering cliffs of RSPB Bempton on the coast to shallow, crystal-clear streams further inland, Charlotte Smith explores England's most northerly chalk outcrop.

videos.title: Montacute House
videos.overview: Matt Baker and Margherita Taylor visits Montacute in Somerset, home to an impressive 400-year-old Elizabethan mansion and some of the rarest wildlife in the UK.

videos.title: Hengistbury Head
videos.overview: Charlotte Smith and Sean Fletcher are on Hengistbury Head in Dorset, where a large-scale engineering project is set to save huge swathes of this coastline from being lost to the sea.

videos.title: Chew Valley
videos.overview: Joe Crowley visits Chew Valley and learns about one of the UK's largest farming projects. He also discovers how the wider Chew Valley inspires those who work and live in the local area.

videos.title: The Fens
videos.overview: Anita and Matt are at the lowest point in the UK, the Fens, to explore the way wildlife and people coexist at and below sea level.

videos.title: Britain's Rarest Creatures
videos.overview: Joe Crowley is on the lookout for some of the UK's most elusive animals at Thursley National Nature Reserve in Surrey, one of the largest remaining areas of heathland.

videos.title: Royal Welsh Show
videos.overview: With over 7,000 livestock being shown, and an expected turnout of 250,000 people, Adam Henson and Charlotte Smith are at one of the largest agricultural shows in Europe  the Royal Welsh

videos.title: Borrowdale
videos.overview: Sean Fletcher explores Borrowdale Oakwoods, England's largest remaining temperate rainforest and one of the rarest habitats on earth.

videos.title: Wakehurst
videos.overview: John Craven, Charlotte Smith and Vick Hope pick the final 12 images that will grace the 2025 Countryfile calendar in aid of BBC Children in Need.

videos.title: Angling
videos.overview: Joe Crowley visits the Dorset coast to team up with a local fly fisherman as he takes on one of the UK's most difficult fish to catch  the mullet.

videos.title: West Exmoor
videos.overview: Sean Fletcher and Anita Rani explore the rugged hills and valleys of west Exmoor, where landscape-scale change is occurring with the introduction of large animals to aid nature restoration.

videos.title: Salisbury Plain
videos.overview: Charlotte and Matt have security clearance to enter Salisbury Plain, where they find out how the Ministry of Defence maintain a balance between military training, farming and conservation.

videos.title: Wild Britain - Anglesey
videos.overview: Joe Crowley and Anita Rani continue Countryfile's Wild Britain initiative, galvanising the nation into helping our beloved wildlife.

videos.title: Kelso Ram Sales
videos.overview: Charlotte Smith visits the Kelso Ram Sales on the Scottish Borders, one of the largest and oldest ram sales in Europe, with more than 3,500 sheep expected to be sold on the day.

videos.title: The Supreme
videos.overview: Adam Henson and Charlotte Smith are in Biggar, South Lanarkshire, at the 2024 International Sheepdog Championship.

videos.title: Stranraer Oyster Festival
videos.overview: Joe Crowley visits Stranraer, on the west coast of Scotland, where people come together every year to celebrate a very special shellfish  the oyster!

videos.title: Autumn Harvest
videos.overview: Joe Crowley visits an Essex potato farm at the height of their harvest, only to discover that the recent rain isn't making it easy to lift the crop.

videos.title: Rare Crop Harvest
videos.overview: It's harvest time, but not as we know it. Charlotte Smith meets pioneering farmer David Mwanaka, who grows crops from his native Zimbabwe.

videos.title: BBC Children in Need Countryfile Rambles 2024
videos.overview: Presenters Matt Baker, Anita Rani, Sean Fletcher, Margherita Taylor and John Craven are celebrating the tenth anniversary of Countryfile Rambles for BBC Children in Need.

videos.title: Westonbirt at Autumn
videos.overview: John Craven visits Westonbirt, The National Arboretum, in Gloucestershire, to see it in all its autumnal glory. At this time of year, 2,500 different species of trees burst into a mosaic of colour.

videos.title: Yorkshire Dales
videos.overview: Sean Fletcher and Sammi Kinghorn are in the Yorkshire Dales with its expansive moors - but the landscape hasn't always looked like this. Sean discovers the Dales were once covered in trees.

videos.title: Northumberland Coast in Autumn
videos.overview: Hamza Yassin finds out about the RSPB's work to safeguard the very rare roseate tern, and Charlotte Smith meets a biosecurity dog helping to protect precious seabird colonies from pests.

videos.title: Woodoaks Farm
videos.overview: John Craven and Margherita Taylor explore Woodoaks Farm in Hertfordshire, where efforts are under way to restore nature's balance and reconnect people with farming.

videos.title: Romney Marsh
videos.overview: Matt Baker and Margherita Taylor are visiting Romney Marsh in Kent, known for its sweeping skies, marshland and shingle beaches, and at this time of year, home to tens of thousands of wintering birds.

videos.title: Peak District
videos.overview: Sammi Kinghorn and Matt Baker explore the Peak District, the first national park created by the transformative National Parks and Access to the Countryside Act of 1949.

videos.title: Christmas at Highgrove
videos.overview: It's Christmas, and Countryfile has received a very special invitation to visit Highgrove Gardens, which surround the private residence of Their Majesties King Charles III and Queen Camilla.

videos.title: Winter Walks
videos.overview: Charlotte heads out on one of Britain's most famous trails, the South West Coast Path, to get a breath of fresh air and discover the power of walking.

videos.title: Winter Wonders
videos.overview: John Craven visits Farmoor Reservoir in Oxfordshire, where many bird species find sanctuary in the cold winter months.

videos.title: The Waterways of the Shropshire Hills
videos.overview: Sammi Kinghorn and Matt Baker explore the waterways of the Shropshire Hills, where the critically endangered Atlantic salmon makes its ancient journey upstream to its spawning grounds.

videos.title: Dartmoor
videos.overview: Anita Rani assists a team from the Devon Wildlife Trust as they try to locate one of the 15 pine martens released into the wilds of Dartmoor earlier in the year.

videos.title: New Forest
videos.overview: Adam Henson and Sean Fletcher explore the rich landscapes of the New Forest, where the animals that roam the heathland and woodlands play an essential role in shaping the landscape.

videos.title: Welney Wetland Centre
videos.overview: Matt Baker and Charlotte Smith head to Welney Wetland Centre in Norfolk for World Wetlands Day, uncovering the vital role these habitats play in supporting a host of bird species.

videos.title: Mourne Mountains
videos.overview: Our friends are in the north to explore the majestic county of Northumberland Matt Baker looks into the area's bloody past and Julia Bradbury learns about crayfish.

videos.title: Sound of Mull
videos.overview: 2025 marks the 50th anniversary of the reintroduction of white-tailed eagles to the UK. Hamza Yassin takes us on a sea eagle safari across the Sound of Mull to Tobermory.

videos.title: Stirling Bull Sales
videos.overview: Adam Henson and Charlotte Smith are at the Stirling Bull Sales, which attract thousands of buyers, sellers and enthusiasts, eager to see and bid on the country's finest livestock.

videos.title: Humber Estuary
videos.overview: Matt, Anita and Adam discover the wonders of the Humber Estuary, a region famed for its bustling port and industry that is also home to diverse wildlife.

videos.title: Kielder Forest
videos.overview: Matt Baker and new presenter Vick Hope explore England's largest forest  Kielder in Northumberland  where they meet the people protecting its ecosystems and preserving its future.

videos.title: The Slate Landscape of North West Wales
videos.overview: Matt Baker and Joe Crowley explore the slate landscape of north west Wales, a Unesco World Heritage site, which is being prepared for a new role in rural tourism after securing a grant.

videos.title: River Otter Return
videos.overview: It's ten years since the start of the River Otter Beaver Project  England's first official beaver reintroduction. John Craven is back in Devon to see how these creatures have been faring.

videos.title: Watercress Line
videos.overview: Matt Baker & Margherita Taylor commemorate 200 years since the birth of the railways with a journey on the Watercress Line in Alresford, Hampshire.

videos.title: Cairngorms Capercaillie
videos.overview: Adam Henson & Charlotte Smith are in the Cairngorms National Park, home to a quarter of the UK's rare and endangered species.

videos.title: Stroudwater Canal
videos.overview: Charlotte Smith and John Craven explore the Stroudwater canal in Gloucestershire, where a major restoration project is bringing this historic waterway back to life.

videos.title: Wembury Coast
videos.overview: John Craven & Vick Hope celebrate new life on the Wembury Coast, from high up on the clifftop to the bedrock of its natural harbour.

videos.title: Forest of Bowland
videos.overview: Margherita Taylor & Joe Crowley are in the Forest of Bowland for a sensory spring feast  soaking up the sights, sounds and flavours of the season.

videos.title: Lambing Special
videos.overview: We follow three of the show's presenters  Adam Henson, Sammi Kinghorn and Matt Baker  who each have their particular approach to lambing season for their own flocks of sheep.

videos.title: Dyfi River
videos.overview: John Craven & Sean Fletcher are in Mid-Wales around the Dyfi river, exploring the hidden stories of wildlife that flock to the area at this time of year - and the people ready to welcome them.

videos.title: Shropshire's Nature Comeback
videos.overview: Charlotte Smith & Matt Baker are in Shropshire, where landscapes are being brought back to life - floodplains are being rewilded, meadows restored and ancient woodlands reimagined.

videos.title: Storrington
videos.overview: Vick Hope & Joe Crowley are in West Sussex to celebrate the revival of the white stork.

videos.title: Bradford: City of Culture
videos.overview: As the BBC celebrates this year's UK City of Culture, we explore how the countryside around Bradford shaped the city and its creative legacy. A story of grit and wool.

videos.title: Farm Innovations
videos.overview: Matt Baker and Margherita Taylor are in Herefordshire to explore some of the latest - and most surprising - innovations in agriculture.

videos.title: Orca Watch
videos.overview: At the northernmost edge of mainland Scotland, a spectacle unfolds  Orca Watch  a chance to catch a glimpse of one of our most awe-inspiring cetaceans. At survey sites dotted along the Caithness coast near John O'Groats, volunteers assemble for an annual nine-day survey to document these creatures, and this year, Hamza is joining them. While he scans the horizon for tell-tale dorsal fins, Hamza learns how citizen science is transforming what we know about one of the ocean's most intelligent and elusive predators. People power' is the mantra of Orca Watch  and as Hamza makes his odyssey along the coast, he joins other people dedicating their lives to nature and the environment here: the teenager championing an endangered butterfly; the volunteers with a passion for their local beaches; and the man who created a haven for terns in his back garden

videos.title: Seaton Wetlands
videos.overview: Matt Baker and Sammi Kinghorn are in and around the east Devon resort of Seaton, finding out how coastal life is shifting with the times.

videos.title: Spurn Point
videos.overview: Sean Fletcher and Anita Rani witness the return of the native oyster after an absence of 85 years to Spurn Point, a narrow three-mile ribbon of land at the mouth of the Humber Estuary.

videos.title: Adam's Farming Families - The Egglestons
videos.overview: Adam heads to Leicestershire to meet three generations of the Eggleston family, who have been producing milk for the local Stilton cheese dairy for over a century.

videos.title: Adam's Farming Families - The Paddas
videos.overview: Adam Henson is in the Vale of Evesham to meet the Padda family  three generations running one of the UK's most vibrant soft fruit farms.

videos.title: Adam's Farming Families - The Bakers
videos.overview: Adam Henson is in Somerset to meet the Baker family  3 generations on a small, mixed farm, juggling cattle, crops and rare-breed pigs.

videos.title: Adam's Farming Families - The Lemons
videos.overview: Adam Henson is in Wiltshire with 3 generations of the Lemon family. Their farm is a large, high-tech, arable operation that's currently going through a number of changes.

videos.title: John Craven's Heritage Yorkshire - Wensleydale Railway
videos.overview: In a series of four special programmes, John Craven explores the heritage of North Yorkshire. As the nation marks 200 years of the railway, John heads to the Wensleydale Railway  a much-loved line brought back to life by volunteers after decades of dereliction. John also delves into the programme's archives for a nostalgic look at the many ways we've travelled across the UK over the years.

videos.title: John Craven's Heritage Yorkshire - Heritage in the Making
videos.overview: John Craven uncovers Yorkshire's rich heritage through traditional grains & age-old crafts, from the historic Holgate windmill, still grinding flour, to a solar-powered micro-distillery.

videos.title: John Craven's Heritage Yorkshire - The River Nidd
videos.overview: Knaresborough is a place steeped in history. But it's the River Nidd's story that flows through it all. John Craven explores the history shaped by the river before meeting those who care for it today.

videos.title: John Craven's Heritage Yorkshire - Yorkshire Champions
videos.overview: John Craven tells the story of Ella Pontefract, Marie Hartley and Joan Ingilby, three women who dedicated their lives to recording the traditions, voices and skills of Yorkshire's rural communities.

videos.title: Bolton Abbe
videos.overview: Countryfile is in Bolton Abbey in North Yorkshire, where John Craven, Hamza Yassin and guest judge Dame Maggie Aderin-Pocock choose the final 12 images for the 2026 Countryfile Calendar.

videos.title: In the Wake of Tarka
videos.overview: Matt Baker and Sammi Kinghorn trace the paw prints of a river legend  Tarka the Otter  to explore how the people of North Devon have helped the Eurasian otter claw back from near-extinction.

videos.title: The Archers
videos.overview: This week, Countryfile heads to Inkberrow in Worcestershire; the village that provided inspiration for Britain's longest-running radio drama, The Archers.

videos.title: Solway Coast
videos.overview: Joe Crowley & Adam Henson explore the Solway Coast, where ancient traditions & fragile wildlife are being carefully nurtured by those who call this borderland home.

videos.title: The Supreme
videos.overview: Matt Baker & Charlotte Smith are in Wrexham for the biggest date in the sheepdog trialling calendar - The Supreme. Show more

videos.title: Countryfile Ramble for BBC Children in Need 2025
videos.overview: The Countryfile Ramble for BBC Children in Need is back! And this year, for the very first time, Ramble HQ is based on a farm, on the Staffordshire-Shropshire border.

videos.title: A Tale of Two Ciders
videos.overview: Charlotte Smith & Adam Henson are in Herefordshire, the UK's Cider capital, at the height of the Apple harvest.

videos.title: Kent Riviera
videos.overview: Charlotte Smith, Matt Baker & Adam Henson are in Kent to explore the influence France had on the 'Garden of England'.

videos.title: Chatsworth- An Evolving Estate
videos.overview: Anita Rani & Sean Fletcher explore the magnificent Chatsworth Estate in Derbyshire  35,000 acres of farmland, woodland & meadows, with the River Derwent running through it's heart.

videos.title: Wiltshire Woods
videos.overview: Charlotte Smith & John Craven, uncover from the forest floor to the canopy above the hidden magic that thrives in Wiltshire's woodlands in autumn.

videos.title: Vegetable Harvest- A Very Tough Year
videos.overview: After a scorching summer, 2025's harvest could be one of the worst in recent years. What could that mean for farmers, our food & for the future of British produce. ??

videos.title: Hamza's Highlands - Scottish Wildcats
videos.overview: Hamza Yassin joins the team behind an ambitious conservation project to help release three wildcats into the Scottish Highlands.

videos.title: Somerset Levels
videos.overview: Anita Rani and Joe Crowley are in the Somerset Levels, where autumn brings a time of transition  a chance to restore the landscape and prepare for winter.

videos.title: The Lake District: Turner's Landscape
videos.overview: John Craven and Vick Hope explore the stunning scenery of the Lake District, following in the footsteps of JMW Turner.

videos.title: The Power Of Water
videos.overview: Matt Baker & Sammi Kinghorn are in Bannau Brycheiniog National Park, where the power of the water that runs through its valleys shapes the landscape both above & below ground. Matt joins a local caving team who are protecting the UK's deepest cave system, while Sammi visits a 200-year-old mill still driven by the force of the water. From one of the wettest corners of the UK to one of the driest, Adam Henson is in Lincolnshire, where a farmer is taking a gamble on a classic Mediterranean crop that thrives in dry conditions; olives.

videos.title: Stonehenge
videos.overview: Joe Crowley and Vick Hope explore Stonehenge, Britain's most iconic prehistoric monument, and uncover fresh discoveries about its origins and role as a gathering place for ancient peoples.

videos.title: A Cornish Christmas
videos.overview: The Cornish coast comes alive as Matt Baker, Anita Rani and Adam Henson uncover the magic of Cadgwith at Christmas. From tree deliveries to seasonal pasty making and a pub full of sea shanties.

videos.title: Hamza's Highlands - Cromarty Dolphins
videos.overview: Hamza Yassin heads to the Cromarty Lighthouse Field Station, where scientists are tracking Scotland's resident bottlenose dolphins in the UK's longest-running study of its kind.
